Joyvert Review - Empires & Puzzles 4-Star Hero Guide

Joyvert brings a violin and a nasty sleeping habit to the battlefield. With massive attack stats and the dreaded Deep Sleep mechanic, she's a nightmare for anyone not immune. But in a world of Toons and Glass heroes, can this moth still fly?
Joyvert: The Moth Virtuoso Who Sings You to Eternal Sleep
Joyvert, The Moth Virtuoso: Serenade 'Em to Sleep (And Death)
Joyvert is a 4-star Nature (Green) hero from the
, released in August 2025. As a member of the whimsical yet deadly Moth crew, she brings a unique blend of high damage and crowd control to the table. She is a

, which allows her to potentially deal extra damage with Jinx, though her primary role is that of a "Sleep Sniper"—incapacitating a target while setting them up for a massive follow-up hit. In an era where 4-star stats are pushing boundaries, Joyvert enters as a glass cannon with a violin, ready to put your enemies to bed... permanently.

Joyvert's design is a delightful mix of fantasy and music. She is depicted as a moth-humanoid hybrid, playing a violin with an energetic, almost mischievous expression. The large, translucent moth wings and the forest-green attire tie her perfectly to the Nature element. It's a refreshing departure from the usual "angry warrior" trope; she looks like she's playing a jig while your team slowly disintegrates. The art captures the "Moth" aesthetic perfectly—fluttery, colorful, and deceptively dangerous.
Joyvert's stat distribution is heavily skewed towards offense.
for a 4-star hero. For context, modern 4-star hitters typically hover around the 750-800 mark. Joyvert blows past this, rivaling older 5-star heroes. She hits
These are on the lower side for modern standards. Compared to a recent tanky 4-star like
(Defense 792, Health 1502), Joyvert is quite fragile. She fits the "Glass Cannon" archetype perfectly—she needs to kill before she gets killed.
"Goodnight Lullaby" is a fascinating skill that combines direct damage with a potent status ailment.
At Fast speed, with her massive 839 attack stat, this initial hit is significant. It's enough to severely dent most 4-star enemies and finish off weakened ones.
This is the core of her kit. It renders the target completely useless—no mana gain, no attacks.
while asleep but wakes up after taking 750 damage. This is a double-edged sword.
If you time it right, you can hit the sleeping target with a massive sniper shot (like from a teammate) that utilizes the +80% damage boost to instantly kill them.
Random tile damage or stray AoE hits can wake them up prematurely, wasting the control effect.
It's a high-skill, high-reward ability. It's not "fire and forget" like standard snipers; it requires you to pay attention to who you are hitting and who is attacking next.
Let's break down the math behind the music.
. She requires 8 tiles to charge (7 with mana troops/bonuses). This allows her to often fire before the enemy defenses are fully set up.
Rough Damage Value: ~2,936 raw damage units (before defense reduction).
Comparison: This is top-tier sniper damage for the 4-star bracket.
The +80% damage intake is massive. If you land a tile that would normally do 100 damage, it does 180. If you land a sniper hit that does 500, it becomes 900.

750 damage. In a 4-star tournament, 750 HP is roughly 40-50% of a hero's total health. This means the sleep is surprisingly durable against tile damage, but will break immediately upon taking a Special Skill hit.
Family Bonus, Passives, Aether Power & Unique Abilities

bonus is notoriously annoying to play against. It typically involves the "Moth Dust" mechanic and passive damage to Minions/Mega Minions. This gives Joyvert utility beyond just her special skill, allowing her to passively whittle down enemy health and keep minion-heavy teams in check.

A flat 15% chance to dodge any damaging special skill. While 15% seems low, in practice, it often triggers exactly when you need it to save her life. Since she is fragile, this passive is her only real lifeline. It can completely swing a match if she dodges a lethal sniper shot.

This increases the damage of her Special Skill when Limit Broken. Given that her primary role is dealing damage, this is the perfect Aether Power for her. It pushes her 350% hit into "one-shot" territory against weaker enemies.
When released, the Moth family introduced powerful passive damage mechanics. Joyvert was seen as a strong offensive option for players who needed Green burst damage.

Stat-wise, she holds up very well offensively. Her 839 Attack is still competitive in late 2025. However, her defensive stats are starting to show their age compared to the new "Titan Hunter" or "Three Kingdoms" 4-stars.
Joyvert struggles immensely in the current meta of

heroes. Toon passives often resist her Deep Sleep, and Glass passives can reflect it. If the Sleep is resisted or reflected, she becomes just a generic sniper. However, in environments without those specific counters (like certain PvE events or lower-tier wars), she remains a powerhouse.
Joyvert is a damage dealer through and through. Her utility relies on her hitting hard and killing targets.
Maximizes her already stellar attack stat. Increases the initial hit of "Goodnight Lullaby" and her tile damage.
Leaves her very squishy. She might die to a few slashes or a single sniper hit.
Helps her survive long enough to fire her skill, especially in rush wars or against fast defenses.
Wastes her best asset (her attack stat). Even with defense emblems, she won't be a tank.
is the way to go. You bring Joyvert to kill things, not to tank hits. Use her in a stack where you can protect her or kill the enemy before they kill her.
One of the hardest hitting 4-stars available.
Completely shutting down an enemy mana generation and attack is powerful.
The +80% damage taken debuff allows for creative "setup" plays to delete key enemy heroes.
She charges quickly, fitting well into fast offensive stacks.
Low defense and health make her an easy target.
(Reflection) families hard-counter her status ailments, making her risky to use in tournaments.
While the sleep can't be cleansed, it breaks on damage. This limits her use on Defense teams where the AI might wake up a sleeping target instantly with a stray tile.
Her high attack and damage amplification are excellent for nuking bosses quickly.
Against weakened teams where counters might already be dead, her speed and damage can clean up the remaining heroes efficiently.
She is a Wizard and hits fast; however, beware of Toons/Glass opponents.
Great for controlling elite enemies or bosses who don't have immunity passives.

Fire Almur for Elemental Defense Down, then Joyvert to Sleep/Damage. Finally, hit the sleeping target with Caedmon (or another heavy hitter). The +80% damage from sleep combined with EDD results in massive damage.
Use her primarily for the +80% damage intake on the boss. Sleep the boss, then unleash your other snipers or tile damage to take advantage of the multiplier.
High chance to resist Deep Sleep.
Chance to reflect Deep Sleep back to Joyvert (putting
Chance to resist the status ailment.
If you use a burn/poison hero
Joyvert, the tick damage might wake up the enemy at the start of their turn, wasting the control aspect (though the damage amp still applies for that tick).
Be careful firing an AoE hero after Joyvert if you intended to keep a specific target asleep.
If you are a new player,

. Her high attack stat will carry you through map stages and early raids easily. The mechanics of Deep Sleep might be tricky to master, but simply using her as a "Fast Sniper" is effective enough in the early game. Prioritize her leveling if you need a strong Green attacker.
For veterans, Joyvert is a niche tool. You likely have 5-star heroes who do what she does but better. However, for
, she has value. Be extremely wary of using her against Toon/Glass teams. She is worth keeping for depth, but maybe not worth a second Limit Break unless you are competitive in 4-star events.
The community reaction to Joyvert was mixed, primarily due to the dominance of passive-heavy meta heroes.
Many players on the forums pointed out,
"Toons/Glass dominate 3 and 4 star levels. No real reason to use any others."
This sentiment highlights her biggest struggle—she relies on an ailment in a meta full of immunities.
On the flip side, players recognized her PvE potential:
"I still have to level a lot of heroes for war so having rose / purple 4 star moth in team helps a lot during cleanup if it’s one / two left since the dust is pretty effective."
, noting that while she hits hard, the consistency of Toon Caedmon often makes him the safer pick.

Joyvert is a virtuoso performer playing in a tough venue. In a vacuum, her stats and skills are fantastic—Fast speed, huge damage, and a crippling status effect. But she is playing her concerto in the middle of a construction site full of Toons and Glass shields. If you can navigate around her counters, she sings a beautiful song of destruction. If not, she’s just another moth hitting a windshield.
A top-tier offensive weapon for Events and specific raid scenarios, but benched against modern defensive meta families.
